qas.question: What did the improvements in quality of life increase?

answers.text: people self-identifying as Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander

qas.question: What has the reappropriation of the word "black" done?

answers.text: resulted in its widespread use in mainstream Australian culture,

qas.question: In what year were there several cases that helped to redefine Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander?
What well known boxer was criticized for question someone's blackness?
Which Journalist was sued for publishing discriminatory comments?

context: This nationwide acceptance and recognition of Aboriginal people led to a significant increase in the number of <a0_0>people self-identifying as Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander<a0_0/>. The reappropriation of the term "black" with a positive and more inclusive meaning has <a1_0>resulted in its widespread use in mainstream Australian culture,<a1_0/> including public media outlets, government agencies, and private companies. In <a2_0>2012<a2_0/>, a number of high-profile cases highlighted the legal and community attitude that identifying as Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander is not dependent on skin colour, with a well-known boxer <a3_0>Anthony Mundine<a3_0/> being widely criticised for questioning the "blackness" of another boxer and journalist <a4_0>Andrew Bolt<a4_0/> being successfully sued for publishing discriminatory comments about Aboriginals with light skin.
